message_1:
What is the solution to the following absolute value equation: 

|4x - 6| = 10
message_2:
To solve the absolute value equation |4x - 6| = 10, we need to consider two cases:

Case 1: 4x - 6 = 10
4x = 16
x = 4

Case 2: 4x - 6 = -10
4x = -4
x = -1

So, the solutions to the equation are x = 4 and x = -1.
